articles.title: Compensation for crimes related to "comfort women for army" called for
Anti-U.S. action called for
articles.content:
Compensation for crimes related to "comfort women for army" called for 
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of Women's Organizations strongly demanded the Japanese government admit its legal responsibility for the crimes related to the "comfort women for the army", punish those responsible for them and compensate for them at the 58th meeting of the un commission on human rights on April 18, Seoul-based Yonhap News reported.
 Recalling that in a report titled "sexual slavery for the Japanese army" submitted to the un commission on human rights in 1998 the organization charged that the Japanese government had a legal responsibility for the crimes and an obligation for compensating for them, it accused the government of still refusing to bear the responsibility for the crimes.    
 It asked the UN commission on human rights to render cooperation in the efforts to make the Japanese government admit its legal responsibility for the crimes, punish those responsible for them and compensate for them.

Aid materials presented by Chinese residents

articles.content:
Aid materials presented by Chinese residents 
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Officials of the central committee of the Association of Chinese Residents in Korea and Chinese in Pyongyang presented aid materials to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on April 22 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 The Chinese said that they would sincerely assist the KPA, learning from the traditional trait of unity between the army and the people now in full bloom in the DPRK, so as to contribute to the development of the China-DPRK friendship.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on revolutionary trait of assisting army
Military attaches' corps visits KPA unit
Anniversary of inter-Korean joint conference observed
articles.content:
Military attaches' corps visits KPA unit 
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Military attaches' corps in Pyongyang visited the Choe Yong Su unit of the Korean People's Army yesterday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the heroic KPA.
 Military attaches looked round historic sites, being briefed on the fact that President Kim Il Sung and Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il visited the unit and set forth the slogan "a-match-for-a-hundred army" to train servicemen to be daring fighters.    
 At the end of the visit, military attache of the Chinese embassy Yan Jiangfeng, who is the doyen of the corps, wished the KPA, which has grown as an invincible army under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, greater success in the defense of the country and socialist construction.

articles.content:
Dominican political party leader arrives 
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Miguel Mejia, secretary general of the united left movement of Dominica, arrived in Pyongyang yesterday on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 The guest was met by vice department director Pak Kyong Son of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea at the airport.

articles.title: Talks held between Korean, Swedish party delegations
articles.content:
Talks held between delegations of WPK and UMNO
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between a delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea and a delegation of the United Malay National Organization (UMNO) today.
 At the talks, both sides informed each other of activities of the two parties and exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly relations between the two parties and a series of matters of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks were vice department director Pak Kyong Son of the Central Committee of the WPK, officials concerned and members of the delegation led by Datuk Ahmad Zahid Bin Hamidi, member of the UMNO supreme council.

articles.title: Talks held between WPK secretary and Bangladeshi party leader
articles.content:
Talks held between Korean, Swedish party delegations
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Talks between the delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea and the Communist Party Marxist Leninist (R) in Sweden were held here today.
 At the talks both sides informed each other of their parties' activities and exchanged views on the issue of developing the friendly relations between the two parities and a series of matters of mutual concern.    
 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, officials concerned and members of the delegation of the Communist Party Marxist Leninist (R) in Sweden led by chairman of its central committee Anders Karlsson.

articles.content:
Talks held between WPK secretary and Bangladeshi party leader
    Pyongyang, April 23 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between secretary Kim Ki Nam of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and general secretary Dilip Barua of the central committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist) in Pyongyang today.
 Both sides informed each other of activities of the two parties and exchanged views on the matter of developing the friendly ties between the two parties and a series of issues of mutual concern.    
 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.
